title: What is the 19th century route between England and India? - Quora

response.answer_text: Before or after the opening of the Suez Canal? Before, around the entire continent of Africa if traveling exclusively by ship. After, through the Suez Canal. However, even after the opening of the Suez Canal and the introduction of steam ships, it still took many months to travel from the UK to India in the 1870s. There weren’t enough coaling stations for early steamships, and passengers were forced to transit by rail on several points along the route. Rail travel wasn’t well developed either, so travelers had to anticipate periods of delay along the route. British merchants stationed in South and East Asia were therefore accorded home leave usually of one year at some point in their tenure overseas, because their bosses knew that it would take them some time to travel back and forth between home and their postings.
